questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statements is/are true about the if statement in C?
question_texts: Which of the following statements is/are true about the if statement in C?

options.option_text: else if is compulsory to use with if statement.
else is compulsory to use with if statement.
else or else if is optional with if statement.
Multiple else if are allowed with if statement.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statements accurately describes the base case in a recursive function in C?
question_texts: Which of the following statements accurately describes the base case in a recursive function in C?

options.option_text: The base case is the first statement executed within the function.
The base case is a condition that triggers an infinite call within the function.
The base case is the condition that ensures the recursive function terminates.
The base case is the condition when the function calls itself.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statement is true about structures and unions in C regarding memory allocation?
question_texts: Which of the following statement is true about structures and unions in C regarding memory allocation?

options.option_text: Structures allocate memory based on the sum of all member sizes.
Unions allocate memory based on the sum of all member sizes.
Memory is shared between members in the structures.
Unions and structures allocate memory in the same way.
